Annotation.String: The capabilities to protect data from loss by the use of a replica.

The capabilities to protect data from loss by the use of a replica. The requirements must be met collectively by the communication path and the replica. There will be one instance associated to a class of service for each replica. Each replica has its own class of service that describes its characteristics.
An enumeration that represents the relative time required to make a replica available as a source.
The enumeration literals shall represent the relative time required to make a replica available as a source.
Active access to synchronous replicas.
Access to synchronous replicas shall be instantaneous.
Passive access to replicas via the same front-end interconnect.
Access to a synchronous replica shall be consistent with switching access to a different path the same front-end interconnect. A restore step shall not be required.
Access to replica via a different front-end interconnect. A restore step is required before recovery can commence.

Access to a replica shall be consistent with switching access to a different path through a different front-end interconnection infrastructure. Some inconsistency may occur. A restore step may be required before recovery can commence.
No direct connection to the replica. (i.e. To a bunker containing backup media).
Access to a replica may take a significant amount of time. No direct connection to the replica is assumed. Some inconsistency loss may occur. A restore step is likely to be required.
Values of this enumeration represent a geographic scope of a failure domain.
The enumeration literals of this enumeration shall represent a geographic scope in which all components within that scope have similar vulnerabilities.
A CPU/memory complex.
Components of a CPU/memory complex that share the same infrastructure.
A container for Servers, Networking, and Storage.
A container within a datacenter that provides communication, power, or cooling to a set of components.
A set of Racks that share common infrastructure.
A set of racks that may share common communication, power, or cooling.
An adjacent set of racks.
A set of adjacent racks or rackgroups that may share common communication, power, or cooling.
A co-located set of servers, including network and storage that share communication, power, or cooling infrastructure.
A facility that provides communication, power, or cooling infrastructure to a co-located set of servers, networking and storage.
A geographical or politically isolated set of resources.
A set of resources that are required to be either geographically or politically isolated from resources not in the resources.
The capabilities to protect data from loss by the use of a replica.

The capabilities to protect data from loss by the use of a replica. The requirements shall be met collectively by the communication path and the replica. There should be one instance associated to a class of service for each replica. Each replica independently should have a class of service that describes its characteristics.
The value identifies this resource.
The value shall be unique within the managed ecosystem.
Supported types of failure domains.
The value of each entry shall specify a supported failure domain.
Supported time intervals defining how much source information can be lost on failure.

The value of each entry shall specify a supported ISO 8601 time interval defining the maximum source information that may be lost on failure. In the case that IsIsolated = false, failure of the domain is not a consideration.
Supported expectations for time to access an alternate replica.

The value of each entry shall specify an enumerated value that indicates a supported expectation for the time required to access an alternate replica. In the case that IsIsolated = false, failure of the domain is not a consideration.
Supported replica types.
The value of each entry shall specify a supported replica type.
Supported minimum lifetime that replica must be maintained.
The value of each entry shall be an ISO 8601 duration that specifies the minimum lifetime required for the replica.
Allocating a replica in a separate fault domain is supported.
A value of true shall indicate that allocating a replica in a separate fault domain is supported. The default value for this property is false.
Contains links to other resources that are related to this resource.
The value of this property shall contains links to other resources that are not contained in this resource.
Collection of known and supported DataProtectionLinesOfService.
The collection shall contain known and supported DataProtectionLinesOfService.
The links object contains the links to other resources that are related to this resource.
The Links property, as described by the Redfish Specification, shall contain references to resources that are related to, but not contained by (subordinate to), this resource.
Collection of known and supported replica Classes of Service.
The collection shall contain known and supported replica Classes of Service.
Updated RecoveryAccessScope enumeration types.
This version was created to force the regeneration of JSON Schema so that OData properties are marked as required, and integer properties are marked as integer rather than number.
This version was created to fix CSDL errors and adds both Redfish Uris and Capability Annotations.
WIP v1.0.5
The available actions for this resource.
The Actions property shall contain the available actions for this resource.
The available actions for this resource.
This type shall contain the available actions for this resource.
This property contains the available OEM specific actions for this resource.
This property shall contain any additional OEM actions for this resource.
The available OEM specific actions for this resource.
This type shall contain any additional OEM actions for this resource.
Use Redfish Location type, and change DataProtectionLineOfService to EntityType. Move enums to unversioned namespace. Change references to unversioned.

Make SupportedLinesOfService be a containment NavigationProperty. This version was also created to force the regeneration of JSON Schema so that OData properties are marked as required, and integer properties are marked as integer rather than number.
This version was created to fix CSDL schema errors.
TP v1.2.1c
This version was added to fix CSDL Capability Annotations.
